Detailed Description

Interface with acospkcs11.dll to provide cryptographic functionality.

Member Function Documentation

void CryptoWrapper::clearError (  )  [inline]
bool CryptoWrapper::encryptFile ( string  fileToEncrypt,
string  encryptedFile,
string  strKeyLabel 
)

Functions for dealing with encryption encryptFile() do the following:

  • Opens the file that wanted to be encrypted, then reads the data, saves it, and then close the file.

  • Encrypts the saved data by calling the encrypt function.
  • Creates a new file to write the encryped data with a header and a footer.
  • Closes the encrypted file.
    Parameters:
    [in] fileToEncrypt Name of file to be encrypted
    [out] encryptedFile Name of file to write encrypted data
    [in] strKeyLabel Certificate Name to use
    Return values:
    bool Returns false on failure and sets
    Remarks:
    Encrypts data with the key given by keyLabel
string * CryptoWrapper::enumerateCards ( void   ) 

Function return list of token present enumerateCards() do the following:

  • Gets the number of cards which have tokens.

  • Creats a pointer to an array that contains slots info (return value).
  • Search readers and store result in SlotWithTokenList.
  • Gets all the slots info
  • Returns list of all slots with a token present
    Parameters:
    void 
    Return values:
    *string Returns pointer to string of tokens
    Remarks:
    Get list of all slots with a token present when there is a acos5 detected within the system
void CryptoWrapper::finalizeCrypto (  ) 

Functions for taking down the crypto environment finalizeCrypto() do the following:

  • Will finalize the Crypto library if it was loaded.

  • Frees the the library.
    Parameters:
    void 
    Return values:
    @remarks Unload acospkcs11 DLL and free memory allocated, destroy enviroment

bool CryptoWrapper::initCrypto (  ) 

Functions for setting up the crypto environment initCrypto() do the following:

  • Makes sure that the DLL was not loaded before.

  • Loads the DLL file.
  • Gets the functions list from the DLL file.
  • Initializes the Cryptoki library
    Parameters:
    void 
    Return values:
    bool Returns false on failure and sets
    Remarks:
    Initializes the crypto enviroment by loading the acospkcs11.dll into memory and retrieve it's functionlist.
vector< string > CryptoWrapper::listKeys (  ) 

Functions for getting the public key from given x509 certificates listKeys() do the following:

  • Sets up the template for the certificate.

  • Initializes the certificate search operation.
  • Starts and keeps searching for certificate.
  • Gets the subject field for each certificate it finds.
  • Decrypts the subject line and get the information that we want.
  • Adds the key to the list.
  • Finishes the certificate search operation.
    Return values:
    vector<string> return a vector string of keys available
    Remarks:
    Search for certificate and retrieve all subject field within certificate and decrypt to get information we need before allow keys to be use in transactions.
string CryptoWrapper::LoadFile ( string  filename  ) 

Functions for dealing with files LoadFile() do the following:

  • Opens the file that wanted to be Decryped or Verify, reads the data and saves it, then closes the file.

  • Parse out whether decrypted or verify.
  • Skips over the first encoding of the data.
  • Skips over the cipherText of the data.
  • Decrypts the data by calling Decrypt function.
  • Verify the signature by calling verify function.
    Parameters:
    [in] filename Name of file to load
    Return values:
    string 
    Remarks:
bool CryptoWrapper::selectCard ( int  SlotID,
CK_UTF8CHAR *  UserPIN,
int  pinlen 
)

Function to select inserted smartcard selectCard() do the following:

  • lists all slots with a token present.

  • Opens a session for the selected card to use for subsequent operations.
  • Logs into the selected token.
    Parameters:
    [in] SlotID The slotid token to be used
    [in] pin Pointer to pin authentication
    [in] pinlen Length of given pin input
    Return values:
    bool Returns false on failure and sets
    Remarks:
    Selects a card to use for subsequent operations.
bool CryptoWrapper::signFile ( string  fileToSign,
string  signedFile,
string  strKeyLabel 
)

Functions for signing files signFile() do the following:

  • Opens the file that wanted to be signed, then reads the data, saves it, and then close the file.

  • Signs the saved data by calling the sign function.
  • Creates a new file to write the signed data with a header and a footer.
  • Closes the signed file.
    Parameters:
    [in] fileToSign Name of file to be signed
    [out] signedFile Name of file to write signed data
    [in] strKeyLabel Certificate Name to use
    Return values:
    bool Returns false on failure and sets
    Remarks:
    digest data with the key given by keyLabel and sign data
